_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary (5/2/2017)



Buckman Laboratories, Inc. was established in 1945 as a manufacturer of specialty chemicals for aqueous industrial systems.  The company was founded on its unique ability to create and manufacture innovative solutions to control the growth of microorganisms. Today, Buckman Laboratories works with industry worldwide providing advanced chemical treatment technologies and extensive technical service to help solve complex industrial problems.  Our expertise spans a broad range of specialty chemicals, including microorganism control, scale inhibitors, corrosion inhibitors, polymers dispersants and defoamers.  

    

Buckman Laboratories, Inc. finished products and raw materials are successfully applied in a number of industries, including pulp and paper, water treatment, agriculture, wood, leather, and coatings.

    

Buckman Laboratories, Inc. established the facility in Cadet, Missouri in the early 1960's.  The Cadet Plant manufactures several of the specialty chemicals mentioned above.  The manufacturing of these products requires the use of several raw material chemicals regulated by the EPA as regulated substances.  The regulated substances handled at the Cadet Plant include the following:

    

-Carbon Disulfide

-Cyclohexylamine 

-Dimethylamine 

-Epichlorohydrin 

-Formaldehyde

-Monomethylamine 

-Phosphorous Trichloride 

    

Manufacturing of the specialty chemicals occurs in the production area of the Cadet Plant, which contains 15 process vessels.  The process vessels are used to react and formulate the various specialty chemical products.  In addition to the process vessels, the manufacturing processes are supported by approximately 70 storage tanks, rail car loading and unloading stations, tanker truck loading and unloading stations, and various utility systems.

    

Production processes are monitored and controlled by a Distributive Control System (DCS), an automated computer control system.  The DCS allows for the continuous monit

oring of thousands of process parameters, and allows for the quick identification of any parameters that may have deviated from their intended range.  The DCS is programmed to automatically correct or alarm these parameter deviations, allowing for the safe operation of the various production processes.  In addition to the DCS, highly trained Chemical Operators perform the day-to-day tasks required to safely operate the various processes.



Referred to as the Golden Principle, Buckman Laboratories, Inc. believes that all occupational injuries and illnesses can be prevented. In addition, Buckman Laboratories has implemented and maintains the following Management Principles to continually guide daily activities:



-Managers are ultimately responsible for safety of their people, their customers and the public.

-Managers will seek involvement of their associates in the elimination of safety hazards in their workplace.

-Safety education is vital to working safely.  Everyone must be trained again and again.

-Good safety behavior is a condition of employment.

-Safety will take precedence over expediency or short cuts.

-Every attempt will be made to reduce the probability of incident occurrence.

-Safeguards will be provided to ensure safe working conditions.

-Safety audits are a must.  All deficiencies must be corrected promptly.

-Where appropriate, safe standards will be set.  They should be reviewed annually.



Buckman Laboratories, Inc. has implemented and maintains the following environmental policy:



Buckman Laboratories, Inc. is committed to operating its facilities in a manner that is sustainable with the environment and the communities where we operate, while maintaining compliance with environmental laws and regulations.  Buckman recognizes that environmental matters are important in the operation of its business and that associates are 100% responsible for ensuring environmental protection.



To achieve these goals:

-Top management provides the leade

rship and resources necessary for responsible environmental management.

-Managers are assigned primary responsibility for the environmental performance of the operations within their control.

-Associates are educated regarding Buckman Laboratories, Inc. environmental policy and their individual responsibilities.

-Qualified staff is maintained to advance the Corporation's knowledge of environmental protection.

-We operate our facility and measure performance against applicable laws, regulations, and standards.

-We practice the Buckman Fundamentals and support Buckman Green sustainability commitments.

-Operating procedures are established and updated to maintain environmental regulatory compliance and ensure responsible environmental management.

-An environmental audit program is maintained to ensure periodic review of the performance of each operation.

-We are committed to pollution prevention achieved through continual improvement in operation.

-We seek to use in order of preference, first, source reduction; second, recycling; third, waste treatment.

-We ensure that the environmental policy is available to the public.

    

 

General Accidental Release Prevention Program & Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

    

Buckman Laboratories, Inc. Cadet Plant complies with the Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA), Accidental Release Prevention Rule, also known as the Risk Management Program, also known as 112(r).  In addition to this rule, the Cadet Plant complies with various Occupational Safety & Health Administration (OSHA) regulations, which address accidental release prevention.  Specifically, Buckman Laboratories has established a Process Safety Management System for each of the regulated substances mentioned above.  In addition, Buckman Laboratories has also included several processes that involve reactive chemistries.  The Process Safety Management System complies with 29 CFR 1910.119 and the requirements of 40 CFR 68.
